For some more background you might want  to visit the following bug report:  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=338621  --> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/WebResource.axd?d=OG6ICBS3XdykvyL_wBngEtwfPZ1xqVL3SJbFznhjfEgbO7QCYjHbDfgdgnO_5IYl31FcIeZ2u_qHqs8zCgU_y6DDpKxLyAV4MxNJVxfxbqAA9wnJHfwytgbvEYfRnFp2CKySbJEfaqzaXNpSNK6oTGhGshY1&t=635319500310794128" media="screen"?> <feed xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/">   <title>Theology and Religious Studies</title>   <subtitle>Established over 50 years ago, the department has research expertise across a wide range of areas and ranked among the top 10 theology departments in the country in the latest Research Assessment Exercise. You can choose from a wide choice of modules, from the life and teaching of Jesus to Darwinism; from English fantasy literature to the Hebrew Bible; and from Christianity to Rabbinic Judaism.</subtitle>   <link href="http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/ugstudy/courses/theologyandreligiousstudies/theologyandreligiousstudies.aspx?RelatedItemsasStandardList_SyndicationType=2" /> <name>Rose Stapleton</name>     </author>     <summary>Through this course you will gain a grounding in the sources and contemporary context for theological reflection by studying the biblical
